cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 220 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to begin a slow west-northwest motion today, then turn northwest to north Monday night–Tuesday, tracking toward the central–upper Texas coast and inland along the upper coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central–upper Texas coast (near Matagorda Bay/Freeport-Galveston corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas, TX to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire central and upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and Texas City shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–60 mph) likely Monday, with a 30% chance of reaching 50 kt; hurricane conditions remain possible under the watch but less likely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in Galveston Bay, including Texas City, especially at high tide beginning late Sunday night into Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches with isolated 20 inch totals forecast along the upper Texas coast; flash and urban flooding likely around Texas City.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor river flooding and prolonged tidal flooding due to Beta’s slow movement.
